abstract: University of Michigan, like many other universities across the country, is grappling with how to address issues of sexual misconduct; school’s Sexual Assault Prevention and Awareness Center trains student volunteers to become confidential counselors, but job has become much more intense now that federal government has laid out new guidelines about how universities should handle student sexual misconduct.
lead_paragraph: Inside the training sessions for University of Michigan resident advisers, who help students just a few years younger than they are navigate a world of sexual misconduct and identity politics.

headline.main: On the Front Line of Campus Sexual Misconduct
